definition: variant of 紀念|纪念[ji4 nian4]
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: Yet did not the chief butler remember Joseph, but forgat him.
sentences.chinese: 酒政却不记念约瑟，竟忘了他。

sentences.english: Rejoice in the LORD, ye righteous; and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
sentences.chinese: 你们义人当靠耶和华欢喜，称谢他可记念的圣名。

sentences.english: Remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice; Selah.
sentences.chinese: 记念你的一切供献，悦纳你的燔祭。

sentences.english: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?
sentences.chinese: 求你记念制造我如抟泥一般，你还要使我归于尘土吗？

sentences.english: For he remembered his holy promise given to his servant Abraham.
sentences.chinese: 这都因他记念他的圣言，和他的仆人亚伯拉罕。

sentences.english: For I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more.
sentences.chinese: 我要宽恕他们的不义，不再记念他们的罪愆。

sentences.english: I remember your ancient laws, O Lord , and I find comfort in them.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华阿，我记念你从古以来的典章，就得了安慰。

sentences.english: Dad went to buy some stationery as souvenirs for my cousin.
sentences.chinese: 父亲去买了一些文具作为记念品送给堂弟。

sentences.english: To perform the mercy promised to our fathers, and to remember his holy covenant;
sentences.chinese: 向我们列祖施怜悯，记念他的圣约。

sentences.english: I didn't know then that I would remember that day for the rest of my life.
sentences.chinese: 当时我也晓得我古后会记念那一天。

sentences.english: Remember the Sabbath day by keeping it holy.
sentences.chinese: 当记念安息日，守为圣日。

sentences.english: Remember, I am your flesh and blood.
sentences.chinese: 你们又要记念我是你们的骨肉。

sentences.english: May their sins be ever before the Lord, and their memory cut off from the earth.
sentences.chinese: 叫那些罪永留在上主前，从地上除去他们的记念。

sentences.english: And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 就说，耶稣阿，你得国降临的时候，求你记念我。

sentences.english: For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.
sentences.chinese: 这都因他记念他的圣言，和他的仆人亚伯拉罕。

sentences.english: To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.
sentences.chinese: 就是那些遵守他的约，记念他的训词而遵行的人。

definition: Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
to pray on behalf of sb
